title: IOS push notifications are not working

milestone.title: 1.23.0 - Alpha
milestone.description:
"This release should feature:

- Onboarding:
  Allow a user to restore their account using a seedphrase

- Syncing
  Allow a user to syncing/pair two unpaired devices

- Communities
  User facing token gating functionality

- General polish:
  further polish of messaging/communities/onboarding"

body:
# Bug Report


## Problem 
currently on IOS notifications are not working - tried in 1-1, community, group chats


#### Expected behavior
can see PN

#### Actual behavior
no PN

### Reproduction

1) Open Status
2) Android: Add contact, start 1-1 chat
3) IOS: turn on PNs in Advanced > Notifications
4) IOS: put app in the background
5) Android: send message to IOS device

### Additional Information

- Status version: nightly 04/01/23
- Operating System: iOS 16.1.1


[comment]: # (Please, add logs/notes if necessary)

[logs (23).zip](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/files/10343234/logs.23.zip)

This is due to push notification servers running only on waku-1.

We should run them as well on waku-2, @jakubgs should be able to help you set that up.
Just make sure you are not running them as a mailserver/waku-1  service, since that's no needed.
This would be a good task for someone who wants to have an insight on how the infrastructure works.

It should be mostly a change of config + deployment, if everything goes smoothly.

Oh, I think i know what this is caused by:
```yaml
# iOS API access key in one of 3 formats: pem, p12 or p8
gorush_ios_key_contents: '<contents of the p8 key file>'
# KeyID from developer account (Certificates, Identifiers & Profiles -> Keys)
gorush_ios_key_id: '<ios_key_id>'
# TeamID from developer account (View Account -> Membership)
gorush_ios_team_id: '<ios_team_id>'
```
https://github.com/status-im/infra-misc/blob/master/ansible/roles/gorush/README.md

I think the change in the Apple Org ownership of the app has caused this.
Oh that too, but also we should use probably deploy a different fleet, or enable it on some existing waku-2 fleet, if they are not already enabled
Does `nim-waku` support Gorush tho?
@jakubgs no, we need to use the go-waku nodes
Fair enough.

I had to create a new key under `Certificates, Identifiers & Profiles` in `Keys`:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2212681/210791884-4bbbcdfb-87cc-4be8-9201-1c7505d60356.png)

I'm assuming we only need the `Apple Push Notifications service (APNs)` option.
Need to still add config to `go-waku.*` fleets.
Yes, also we need to change the config of the fleet to run on waku v2, unless you added it to some nodes already running on waku v2.

Are we sure `go-waku` supports Gorush?
https://github.com/waku-org/go-waku/search?q=gorush

I see no reference, while `status-go` clearly does support it via `` config:
```go
type Config struct {
	Enabled bool
	// Identity is our identity key
	Identity *ecdsa.PrivateKey
	// GorushUrl is the url for the gorush service
	GorushURL string

	Logger *zap.Logger
}
```
https://github.com/status-im/status-go/blob/d70d3cdf8c92a786a9fbfab7d2295547546f2aed/protocol/pushnotificationserver/server.go#L26-L34
@jakubgs status-go does, through go-waku, basically we just need to start a messenger with Waku v2 config & push notifications enabled, I believe.
What do you mean by "messenger"? Some kind of new bridge-type node that will talk to other fleets and gorush?

I see there's a `WakuV2Config` section in `status-go` config I didn't see before:
https://github.com/status-im/status-go/blob/7d04be3613585a5ea0d6232e76353f67a7c7adfa/params/config.go#L155-L212

Is that what you mean?

According to @richard-ramos you cannot use both `WakuConfig` and `WakuV2Config` at the same time.

This means we'd need a separate set of `status-go` nodes with `WakuV2Config` and `PushNotificationServerConfig` enabled.

I guess this ties into this issue I've opened a while ago:

* https://github.com/status-im/infra-push-notify/issues/1

I've deployed a fleet in 3 data centers running Gorush and Status-go speaking Waku v2: https://github.com/status-im/infra-push-notify/issues/1#issuecomment-1382188712

@cammellos how can we verify that his works properly? Any ideas?

@pavloburykh has reported that notification issues still persist, but the endpoint is functioning:
```
 > c https://gorush.status.im/health     
OK

 > c -XPOST https://gorush.status.im/api/push
curl: (22) The requested URL returned error: 400
{"code":400,"message":"Missing notifications field."}
```
Could you elaborate on the symptoms?

I think I see what's happening. There's two Apple accounts:

* Old one, under which the `1.20.2` release was published
* New one, under which the current nightly and PR builds are being published

Considering that it might be necessary to run two Gorush services. One configured for the old account and one for the new.
Leaving `eth.prod` fleet to use the old https://gorush.status.im/ endpoint using old Apple account, and create a separate endpoint for use with Waku v2 fleets like `status.prod`.

> @pavloburykh has reported that notification issues still persist, but the endpoint is functioning:
> 
> ```
>  > c https://gorush.status.im/health     
> OK
> 
>  > c -XPOST https://gorush.status.im/api/push
> curl: (22) The requested URL returned error: 400
> {"code":400,"message":"Missing notifications field."}
> ```
> 
> Could you elaborate on the symptoms?

Here is a video of current behaviour in latest nightly build. 

[IOS_logs_no_push.zip](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/files/10446138/IOS_logs_no_push.zip)

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97245802/213170586-b5cd853c-2b0f-4441-8d3a-2420447cf399.mp4
But in the chat you mentioned release `1.20`. Which one is it? The `1.20` release or the nightly that has the issue? Or both?

> > Here is a video of current behaviour in latest nightly build.
> 
> But in the chat you mentioned release `1.20`. Which one is it? The `1.20` release or the nightly that has the issue? Or both?

the above video is from nightly. But on 1.20 behaviour is the same.
I've re-deployed the old service and changed the domain for the new one: https://github.com/status-im/infra-push-notify/issues/1#issuecomment-1387037668

> I've re-deployed the old service and changed the domain for the new one: [status-im/infra-push-notify#1 (comment)](https://github.com/status-im/infra-push-notify/issues/1#issuecomment-1387037668)

any additional changes should be done in status-mobile or push notifs (both for nightly and 1.20) should already be fixed on IOS and can be tested?

The nodes on `eth.*` fleets just use the usual https://gorush.status.im/ endpoint:
https://github.com/status-im/infra-role-status-go/blob/238594b97bdb5e11d3add039adefb56748a583e9/defaults/main.yml#L69-L70

So in theory it should Just Work, unless there's some weird persistent TCP connection that's broken or something.

> The nodes on `eth.*` fleets just use the usual https://gorush.status.im/ endpoint: https://github.com/status-im/infra-role-status-go/blob/238594b97bdb5e11d3add039adefb56748a583e9/defaults/main.yml#L69-L70
> 
> So in theory it should Just Work, unless there's some weird persistent TCP connection that's broken or something.

I have just checked on 1.20 which has eth.prod by default. Unfortunately push notifs still don't work on IOS.

Why do you quote everything?

@cammellos any idea how to debug this? I believe you wrote most of the PN code in `status-go`.
@jakubgs it should show an error in the logs, otherwise we can set `sync` to true to return errors in the api, can you see anything in the logs?
@jakubgs apple servers, can the host connect to it?

Fuck, it's the firewall rules order again:
```
admin@node-01.do-ams3.gorush.misc:~ % sudo nmap -Pn -p443 17.188.180.15
Nmap scan report for 17.188.180.15
Host is up (0.14s latency).

PORT    STATE SERVICE
443/tcp open  https
```
```
admin@node-01.do-ams3.gorush.misc:~ % d exec -it gorush sh  
/ # wget -T5 -So- https://17.188.180.15:443
Connecting to 17.188.180.15:443 (17.188.180.15:443)
wget: download timed out
```
